newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan crude steel output seen up in April-June qtr.
newsitem.headline: Japan crude steel output seen up in April-June qtr.

text.p: Japan's crude steel production in the April-June period is likely to reach 27 million tonnes, Takashi Imai, chairman of the Japan Iron and Steel Federation, told reporters on Thursday.
This would be up from 24.86 million tonnes in the same quarter last year.
"Japan's economy is not bad, generally, so production in the car and machinery sectors is not bad," Imai said.
He added that crude steel output in the second quarter of fiscal 1997/98 was likely to be around 26 million tonnes, up slightly from 24.20 million tonnes in the same quarter last year.
Overseas demand for steel has remained steady, Imai said.
"In such conditions, export prices for Europe are on an uptrend, and prices for Japanese steel exports have started to recover," he said.
